title.native: スコット・ピルグリム テイクス・オフ

description:
When girl meets boy, love takes off...

Scott Pilgrim meets the girl of his dreams, Ramona Flowers, but learns he must defeat her seven evil exes in order to date her. Then things get even more complicated. Based on the graphic novels by Bryan Lee O'Malley.

(Source: Science Saru, Netflix)
synonyms: สก็อตต์ พิลกริมออกสตาร์ท

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Band
tags.description: Main cast is a group of musicians.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Hikikomori
tags.description: Prominently features a character who withdraws from social life, often seeking extreme isolation.

tags.name: Rock Music
tags.description: Centers on the musical style of rock, not to be applied to anime that use rock in its soundtrack.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Boys' Love
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two males, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Skateboarding
tags.description: Centers around or prominently features skateboarding as a sport.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

node.description:
[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/radiomaru/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bryanleeomalley) 

Canadian comic artist and writer best known for creating the *Scott Pilgrim* series. Also created  *Lost at Sea*, *Seconds*, and *Snot Girl*.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/radiomaru/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bryanleeomalley) 

Canadian comic artist and writer best known for creating the *Scott Pilgrim* series. Also created  *Lost at Sea*, *Seconds*, and *Snot Girl*.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/edgarwright/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/edgarwright)

English filmmaker. He is known for his fast-paced and kinetic, satirical genre films, which feature extensive utilisation of expressive popular music, Steadicam tracking shots, dolly zooms and a signature editing style that includes transitions, whip pans and wipes. 

Popular films he has directed include:
- Baby Driver (2017)
- The World's End (2013)
- Scott Pilgrim vs. The World (2010)
- Hot Fuzz (2007)
- Shaun of the Dead (2004)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/e8144) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/eunyoung_tokyo)

Eun-Yeong Choi is an animator, director and producer. Since 2020, she is the President and CEO of the animation studio [Science SARU](https://anilist.co/studio/6145/), which she co-founded with [Masaaki Yuasa](https://anilist.co/staff/100068/) in 2013. A frequent collaborator with Yuasa, she has been involved in all of his projects since _[Kemonozume](https://anilist.co/anime/1454/)_ (2006).

Choi began her career as an animator on shows such as _[Witchblade](https://anilist.co/anime/935/)_, _[Black Lagoon](https://anilist.co/anime/889/)_ and _Kemonozume_ (all 2006). She made her directorial debut in 2008 on episodes of _[Kaiba](https://anilist.co/anime/3701/)_, and later worked as assistant director on _[Kick-Heart](https://anilist.co/anime/16149/)_ (2013). Choi transitioned to producer in 2017, beginning with _[The Night Is Short, Walk On Girl](https://anilist.co/anime/97917/)_. In 2021, she returned to directing, helming an episode of _Star Wars: Visions_.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [writer](https://anilist.co/staff/249891) or the younger [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/283043)._
Originating from [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/).
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/木村絵理子)

[Twitter](https://x.com/PJciDsLcfywX1BI?s=20)

Affiliated with [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2313779604)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sui_ekou)
Affiliated with [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ebisu1984)

Originating from [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). Currently freelance with a seat at [Trigger](https://anilist.co/studio/803/).

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/keisukeyanagi01)__

__Keisuke Yanagi__ is a Japanese editor.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kura_fuji)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/GongoraAbel) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aberukuma/)

Abel Góngora is a Spanish animator and director known for his work with the Japanese animation studio Science SARU. Having joined the studio as one of its first employees, Góngora serves as the head of Science SARU's digital animation department and has specialized in the use of Adobe Animate.

Góngora began his career in Europe, joining the Irish animation studio Cartoon Saloon in 2006. He initially served as a location designer and later became an animator, working on the television series *"Skunk Fu!"* (2007–08). 

In 2007, Góngora moved to the French animation studio Ankama, where he worked as an animator on the initial seasons of the company's Flash-animated series *"Wakfu"* (2008–12). During this time, Ankama opened a Japanese subsidiary, Ankama Japan, and Góngora was one of the animators who temporarily relocated to Tokyo, where he collaborated with director Masaaki Yuasa. 

After Ankama Japan closed in 2011, Góngora returned to the main Ankama studio in France. However, he remained in touch with Yuasa and his producer associate Eunyoung Choi, and following the foundation of Science SARU in 2013, joined the new company.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ishi_furo)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ishi_furo)

[Website](https://www.anamanaguchi.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/anamanaguchi) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/anamanaguchi_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtdPSQIDsZyhq3L7kITrKoA)

Anamanaguchi is a four-piece band from New York and Los Angeles.

Since forming in the mid-2000s, Anamanaguchi have been revered as pioneers in the homemade, video game world of chiptune music: they combine a loud and fast live band with hyper-melodic squarewaves from hacked Nintendo hardware. Their earliest releases have been distributed on NES cartridges you can actually play, and in 2010 they created the official soundtrack to the Scott Pilgrim vs. The World game. 

__Members:__
Peter Berkman - lead songwriter and guitarist
James DeVito - bassist
Ary Warnaar - guitarist
Luke Silas - drummer

[Website](https://play.reelcrafter.com/joecomposer/joecomposer) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/JoeComposer) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/joecomposer)

American composer and music producer known for integrating his extensive classical training with his skill producing electronic music. His first major break came in 2010 when he worked with Daft Punk on the sweeping digital soundtrack to Disney’s Tron reboot/sequel. Trapanese followed that success by creating a score with Mike Shinoda of Linkin Park for the American release of the 2011 Indonesian martial arts film The Raid: Redemption (he would continue without Shinoda in 2014 with The Raid 2). Additionally, Trapanese has conducted the Hollywood Bowl Orchestra, Estonian National Symphony Orchestra, AUKSO Poland, and numerous festival and studio orchestras.

American producer who has worked in film, theatre, and television. He has received numerous accolades including two Tony Awards, two Primetime Emmy Awards, as well as nominations for three Academy Awards.
